definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]

sentences.english: She tucked up her skirt and waded across the stream.
Walking home in the snow, we got chilled to the bone.
sentences.chinese: 我们蹚着雪往家走，快要冻僵了。

sentences.english: The river is not deep; we can walk through it.
sentences.chinese: 这河不深，我们可以蹚水过去。

sentences.english: He turned up the ends of his trousers and waded across the river.
Go and find out how deep the stream is and whether we can wade across.
sentences.chinese: 你去探一下这条小河的深浅，看能不能蹚水过去。

sentences.english: We went for a wade in the shallows.
The children waded out into the lake.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一路蹚水到了湖里。

sentences.english: She tucked up her skirt and waded into the river.
sentences.chinese: 她撩起裙子蹚水走进河里。

definition: variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]
level with one's knees/knee-length (skirt etc)/knee-deep (mud etc)
to tread water/to paddle or tramp in shallow water
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
edge (used directly after a noun, e.g. roadside 馬路沿兒|马路沿儿)
